org.jboss.windup.graph.traversal

Class ProjectModelTraversal

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jboss.windup.graph.traversal.ProjectModelTraversal

  • public class ProjectModelTraversal
extends Object
    This allows a ProjectModel to be traversed in a way that is aware of DuplicateProjectModels. This should make it easier to calculate the actual path within the application without regard to where the original project was actually stored. Cases where this is used include:
    • Listing all of the files in the application with accurate paths, regardless of how they are stored in the graph
    • The application details report, which traverses the applications in a hierarchical manner.
    Author:
    Jesse Sightler, Ondrej Zizka, zizka@seznam.cz

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProjectModelTraversal

        public ProjectModelTraversal(ProjectModelTraversal previous,
                             ProjectModel current,
                             TraversalStrategy traversalStrategy)
        Builds an instance with a reference to the previous ProjectModelTraversal, and the given parameters. NOTE: This would generally only be used by TraversalStrategy implementations. DefaultTraversalStrategy

      • ProjectModelTraversal

        public ProjectModelTraversal(ProjectModel current)
        Creates a new ProjectModelTraversal based upon the provided ProjectModel. The ProjectModel should be a "root" model (an application) rather than a subpart of an application. TraversalStrategy will default to AllTraversalStrategy.

      • ProjectModelTraversal

        public ProjectModelTraversal(ProjectModel current,
                             TraversalStrategy traversalStrategy)
        Creates a new ProjectModelTraversal based upon the provided ProjectModel. The ProjectModel should be a "root" model (an application) rather than a subpart of an application. The provided TraversalStrategy will determine how the ProjectModel's subprojects tree will be traversed.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllProjects

        public Set<ProjectModel> getAllProjects(boolean recursive)
        Recursively crawls this ProjectModelTraversal and adds all of the ProjectModels to a Set. The exact projects returns will be affected by the TraversalStrategy in use by the current traversal.

      • getAllProjectsAsVertices

        public Set<org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.Vertex> getAllProjectsAsVertices(boolean recursive)
        Recursively crawls this ProjectModelTraversal and adds all of the ProjectModels to a Set. The exact projects returns will be affected by the TraversalStrategy in use by the current traversal. This is the same as getAllProjects(boolean) except that it returns a Set of vertices instead of frames.

      • accept

        public void accept(ProjectTraversalVisitor visitor)
        Implements the Visitor pattern with a callback that receives each ProjectModelTraversal instance. This can be useful for implementing algorithms that need to operate over all of the data within this traversal. Note that the children visited will be affected by the current TraversalStrategy selected for this traversal.

      • getChildren

        public Iterable<ProjectModelTraversal> getChildren()
        Gets all child projects of the current project.

      • getFilePath

        public String getFilePath(FileModel fileModel)
        Gets the path of the specified FileModel within this traversal. The file must be within the current ProjectModel for this method to return an accurate path.

      • getTraversalState

        public ProjectModelTraversal.TraversalState getTraversalState()
        Returns a status indicating whether or not this should skip certain parts of the traversal for this node.

      • getCanonicalProject

        public ProjectModel getCanonicalProject()
        Gets the canonical Project by unwrapping any DuplicateProjectModels wrapping it.

      • getCurrent

        public ProjectModel getCurrent()
        Gets the current ProjectModel without unwrapping.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the internal state of this traversal, so it can be reused.
